ghostPage.meta_description:
State of the art techniques in DL? You bet.
Atomic-scale defects in 2d ferretmagnets from 1st principles? Sounds right.
Who know what else we might learn!!

ghostPage.plaintext:
For the latest and okayest in Research articles and industry analysis, or a 
Google Drive Folder
[https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/0B9iRL20imonTNXdJd0xtQW1QREk?usp=sharing] 
with 200+ pieces of content I thought were interesting.

Latest additions are:

 * State-of-the-art Techniques in Deep Edge Intelligence
   [https://arxiv.org/abs/2008.00824] by Ahnaf Hannan Lodhi, Barış Akgün, and
   Öznur Özkasap.
 * Atomic-scale defects in the two-dimensional ferromagnet CrI3 from first
   principles [https://arxiv.org/abs/2001.01651] Michele Pizzochero1, 2, ∗
   1
   Institute of Physics, Ecole Polytechnique F´ed´erale de Lausanne (EPFL),
   CH-1015 Lausanne, Switzerland
   2National Centre for Computational Design and Discovery of Novel Materials
   (MARVEL),
   Ecole Polytechnique F´ed´erale de Lausanne (EPFL), CH-1015 Lausanne,
   Switzerland
   (Dated: January 7, 2020)
ghostPage.html:
For the latest and okayest in Research articles and industry analysis, or a Google Drive Folder with 200+ pieces of content I thought were interesting.

Latest additions are:

  • State-of-the-art Techniques in Deep Edge Intelligence by Ahnaf Hannan Lodhi, Barış Akgün, and Öznur Özkasap.
  • Atomic-scale defects in the two-dimensional ferromagnet CrI3 from first principles Michele Pizzochero1, 2, ∗
    1
    Institute of Physics, Ecole Polytechnique F´ed´erale de Lausanne (EPFL), CH-1015 Lausanne, Switzerland
    2National Centre for Computational Design and Discovery of Novel Materials (MARVEL),
    Ecole Polytechnique F´ed´erale de Lausanne (EPFL), CH-1015 Lausanne, Switzerland
    (Dated: January 7, 2020)
